sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Polarimeter for measurement of optical rotation and specific rotation of optically active pharmaceutical substances.
sections.scope: Applicable to optical rotation measurement activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed on a stable surface away from vibrations and temperature fluctuations.
Power ON the polarimeter and allow the light source to stabilize for at least 15 minutes.
Select the appropriate wavelength (typically sodium D-line at 589 nm) for measurement.
Clean the polarimeter tube thoroughly with distilled water and dry completely.
Verify the tube length and record it as it is required for specific rotation calculation.
Fill the tube with solvent (blank) and ensure no air bubbles are present.
Place the tube in the polarimeter chamber and ensure proper alignment.
Perform blank measurement with solvent and zero the instrument if necessary.
Record the blank reading for reference and verification.
Remove the tube, empty it, and rinse with a small portion of sample solution.
Fill the tube completely with the sample solution avoiding air bubbles.
Wipe the outer surface of the tube to remove any solution or fingerprints.
Place the tube back into the chamber ensuring it is properly seated.
Allow the temperature to equilibrate if temperature control is used.
Take the optical rotation reading and record the value with sign (+ or -).
Perform multiple readings (at least 3-5) and calculate the average.
Verify that the readings are consistent and within acceptable range.
Calculate specific rotation using the formula with concentration and path length.
Clean the polarimeter tube immediately after use with appropriate solvent.
Document all readings, temperature, concentration, and calculations in the analytical record.
precautions: Ensure the sample solution is clear and free from suspended particles.
Avoid air bubbles in the tube as they affect the optical path.
Maintain constant temperature during measurement as optical rotation is temperature-dependent.
Use accurate concentration and path length values for specific rotation calculation.
Handle the polarimeter tube carefully to avoid breakage.
Clean the tube thoroughly between different samples to prevent contamination.
Verify the instrument zero reading periodically with solvent.
Use freshly prepared solutions as some compounds may undergo degradation.
Wear appropriate PPE when handling samples and solvents.
